{"word":"harassing","priority":"★★☆","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"verb (present participle)","definition":"(動詞 harass の現在分詞形) 嫌がらせをする、悩ませる、困らせる","english_definition":"Present participle of harass: To disturb persistently; torment; to trouble continually; to persecute; to annoy continually.","examples":[{"sentence":"He was accused of harassing his former employee.","translation":"彼は以前の従業員に嫌がらせをしたとして告発された。"},{"sentence":"The media is constantly harassing the celebrity.","translation":"メディアは常にその有名人を悩ませている。"},{"sentence":"Stop harassing me with your constant demands!","translation":"絶え間ない要求で私を困らせるのはやめてくれ！"}],"collocations":["sexual harassing (セクハラ)","online harassing (ネット上での嫌がらせ)","persistently harassing (執拗に嫌がらせをする)"],"synonyms":["annoying","bothering","pestering","tormenting","bullying","intimidating"],"antonyms":["assisting","helping","supporting","comforting"]},{"part_of_speech":"adjective","definition":"嫌がらせの、悩ましい、困った","english_definition":"Troubling, annoying, or persecuting.","examples":[{"sentence":"She described the harassing phone calls she had been receiving.","translation":"彼女は受けていた嫌がらせの電話について説明した。"},{"sentence":"The company has a zero-tolerance policy for harassing behavior.","translation":"その会社は、嫌がらせ行為に対して断固たる態度をとる方針を持っている。"},{"sentence":"He filed a complaint about the harassing emails he received.","translation":"彼は受け取った嫌がらせのメールについて苦情を申し立てた。"}],"collocations":["harassing behavior (嫌がらせ行為)","harassing phone calls (嫌がらせの電話)","harassing emails (嫌がらせのメール)","harassing messages (嫌がらせのメッセージ)"],"synonyms":["annoying","troublesome","disturbing","irritating","vexing","oppressive"],"antonyms":["pleasant","agreeable","comforting","supportive"]}],"etymology":{"value":"The word 'harass' comes from the Old French 'harasser,' meaning 'to set a dog on.' This likely evolved from the idea of persistently chasing or troubling someone.","priority":"★★☆"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/həˈræsɪŋ/","syllables":"ha-rass-ing"},"inflection":{"notes":"'Harassing' is the present participle and gerund of the verb 'harass.' As an adjective, it does not have comparative or superlative forms."}, "usage_notes":{"explanation":"'Harassing' is used to describe actions that persistently disturb, annoy, or trouble someone. It often implies a pattern of behavior rather than a single incident. The term is commonly used in legal and workplace contexts to describe unwelcome and offensive conduct.","priority":"★★★"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"✗ He is harassing of her.","correct":"✓ He is harassing her.","note":"The verb 'harass' is transitive and does not require the preposition 'of' after it when used in the active voice."},{"incorrect":"✗ The harassing was terrible.","correct":"✓ The harassment was terrible.","note":"'Harassing' is a verb form or an adjective. The noun form is 'harassment'."}],"priority":"★★☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["harass (verb: 嫌がらせをする)","harassment (noun: 嫌がらせ)","harasser (noun: 嫌がらせをする人)"],"phrasal_verbs":[],"priority":"★★★"},"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"B2","frequency_google_ngram":"Moderately frequent","priority":"★☆☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"B2","text":"The word 'harassing' describes actions that persistently bother or trouble someone. This word is commonly used in legal and professional contexts when discussing inappropriate or illegal behavior.","priority":"★★☆"},"example_sentences":[{"sentence":"The student was suspended for harassing other students online.","translation":"その学生は、オンラインで他の学生に嫌がらせをしたため停学処分になった。","type":"verb (present participle)","meaning_category":"嫌がらせをする"},{"sentence":"She reported the harassing emails to the police.","translation":"彼女は嫌がらせのメールを警察に届け出た。","type":"adjective","meaning_category":"嫌がらせの"},{"sentence":"His harassing behavior created a hostile work environment.","translation":"彼の嫌がらせ行為は敵対的な職場環境を作り出した。","type":"adjective","meaning_category":"嫌がらせの"},{"sentence":"The company has a strict policy against harassing employees.","translation":"その会社には、従業員への嫌がらせに対する厳格な方針がある。","type":"adjective","meaning_category":"嫌がらせの"},{"sentence":"He is being investigated for allegedly harassing a coworker.","translation":"彼は同僚に嫌がらせをした疑いで調査を受けている。","type":"verb (present participle)","meaning_category":"嫌がらせをする"}]}
